page.title: 13Employment
page.content: The major sourceds of employment are farming, agricultural labouring and contracting. The farms are family concerns employing 1 or 2 outside workers; abour half are farmed by second or subsequent generations. The village shop, 2 pubs and 2 garages (not all in this section of the map) are all family concerns employing about 16 full and 22 part-timers, some only in the holiday season. The council employs a warden and a home help for the elderly. The school has 2 teachers and 4 part-time employees. The surgery has a receptionist, the Church a vicar. Many people travel to Exeter and Crediton to work in light industry and the public services. Others are self-employed as thatchers,hairdressers, market gardeners, general handymen and builders. By Mrs Jeffery.
